name: Avoid table and column names that are too long (portability)
description:
Reports all entities or column defined through annotation or XML that define a table or column name length greater than 30. 
The table and column name length are parameters that can be changed at will.
output:
This report lists all entities or property defined through annotation or XML that define a table or column name length greater than 30.
It provides the following information:
Persistent Entity name or Persistent Property name
rationale:
If you specify table name too long you won't be able to create it on some database. This will prevent you to use these table name unless you use a Naming Strategy to reduce the length of the table name.

To ease portability, choose table name with a length accepted by the majority of database you want to support.
remediation:
Change the table name size or use a Naming Strategy to reduce the table name length.

Some facts from http://www.mssqlcity.com/Articles/Compare

                                table name length     column name length
SQL Server 2000   128                            128
ASE 12.5                  30                              30
MYSQL 4.1               64                              64
DB2 8.1                  128                            128
Oracle 9i                  30                              30
total: Number of persistent entities and properties
